issue.title: Copy from upstream (Kyber), add pqcrystals-* licenses to README
issue.body:
- Pulls latest Kyber commit from upstream (pqcrystals)
- Updates readme with pqcrystals license information (CC0 or Apache-2.0)

Fixes #1402 

<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body: Thank you very much! It's a significant step forward!

issue.title: Copy from upstream (Kyber), add pqcrystals-* licenses to README
issue.body:
- Pulls latest Kyber commit from upstream (pqcrystals)
- Updates readme with pqcrystals license information (CC0 or Apache-2.0)

Fixes #1402 

<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body:
> Thank you very much! It's a significant step forward!

Re-reviewing things I wonder whether there's now a mismatch between upstream repo and `liboqs` wrt Dilithium: @bhess you manually changed the README for Dilithium, but the copy_from_upstream didn't modify the algorithm documentation, so this PR now introduces conflicting license statements (between https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/tree/bhe-crystallic#license and https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/bhe-crystallic/docs/algorithms/sig/dilithium.md ): Is that truly intentional?

issue.title: Copy from upstream (Kyber), add pqcrystals-* licenses to README
issue.body:
- Pulls latest Kyber commit from upstream (pqcrystals)
- Updates readme with pqcrystals license information (CC0 or Apache-2.0)

Fixes #1402 

<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body:
> @bhess you manually changed the README for Dilithium, but the copy_from_upstream didn't modify the algorithm documentation, so this PR now introduces conflicting license statements (between https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/tree/bhe-crystallic#license and https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/bhe-crystallic/docs/algorithms/sig/dilithium.md ): Is that truly intentional?

Oh I missed to update the algorithm documentation yml/md for both Dilithium and Kyber, will add it with a commit. Thanks for noticing.
Dilithium didn't need to be updated since the dual license was already added the last time we pulled from upstream.

issue.title: Bump markdown-it-py from 0.6.2 to 2.2.0 in /scripts/copy_from_upstream

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [markdown-it-py](https://github.com/executablebooks/markdown-it-py) from 0.6.2 to 2.2.0.
Release notes

Sourced from markdown-it-py's releases.

v2.2.0

What's Changed

  • ‚¨ÜÔ∏è UPGRADE: Allow linkify-it-py v2 by @‚Äãhukkin in #218
  • üêõ FIX: CVE-2023-26303 by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in #246
  • üêõ FIX: CLI crash on non-utf8 character by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in #247
  • üìö DOCS: Update the example by @‚Äãredstoneleo in #229
  • üìö DOCS: Add section about markdown renderer by @‚Äãholamgadol in #227
  • üîß Create SECURITY.md by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in #248
  • üîß MAINTAIN: Update mypy's additional dependencies by @‚Äãhukkin in #217
  • Fix typo by @‚Äãjwilk in #230
  • üîß Bump GH actions by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in #244
  • üîß Update benchmark pkg versions by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in #245

New Contributors

Thanks to üéâ

  • @‚Äãjwilk made their first contribution in #230
  • @‚Äãholamgadol made their first contribution in #227
  • @‚Äãredstoneleo made their first contribution in #229

Full Changelog: https://github.com/executablebooks/markdown-it-py/compare/v2.1.0...v2.2.0

v2.1.0

What's Changed

  • üîß MAINTAIN: Add a profiler tox env by @‚Äãhukkin in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#197
  • üîß MAINTAIN: Update performance benchmark by @‚Äãhukkin in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#196
  • ‚ú® NEW: Save ordered list numbering by @‚Äãhukkin in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#192
  • ‚¨ÜÔ∏è UPGRADE: Drop support for EOL Python 3.6 by @‚Äãhukkin in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#194
  • üß™ TEST: Space in link destination generates IndexError by @‚Äãmib112 in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#206
  • üìö DOCS: Fix typos by @‚Äãkianmeng in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#203
  • üîß MAINTAIN: Move from setuptools to flit by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#208
  • üìö DOCS: Fix build by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#209
  • üîß MAINTAIN: Add isort hook by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#210
  • ‚ôªÔ∏è REFACTOR: Move internal Rule/Delimiter to dataclass by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#211
  • ‚ôªÔ∏è REFACTOR: Move Token to dataclass by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#212
  • üìö DOCS: Update usage guide to use PyPI package name by @‚Äãthibaudcolas in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#202
  • üêõ FIX: Combination of blockquotes, list and newlines causes IndexError by @‚Äãhukkin in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#207
  • ‚ôªÔ∏è REFACTOR: slots for dataclasses by @‚Äãhukkin in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#214
  • üöÄ RELEASE: v2.1.0 by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#213

New Contributors

  • @‚Äãmib112 made their first contribution in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#206
  • @‚Äãkianmeng made their first contribution in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#203
  • @‚Äãthibaudcolas made their first contribution in executablebooks/markdown-it-py#202

Full Changelog: https://github.com/executablebooks/markdown-it-py/compare/v2.0.1...v2.1.0

v2.0.1

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from markdown-it-py's changelog.

2.2.0 - 2023-02-22

What's Changed

  • ‚¨ÜÔ∏è UPGRADE: Allow linkify-it-py v2 by @‚Äãhukkin in #218
  • üêõ FIX: CVE-2023-26303 by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in #246
  • üêõ FIX: CLI crash on non-utf8 character by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in #247
  • üìö DOCS: Update the example by @‚Äãredstoneleo in #229
  • üìö DOCS: Add section about markdown renderer by @‚Äãholamgadol in #227
  • üîß Create SECURITY.md by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in #248
  • üîß MAINTAIN: Update mypy's additional dependencies by @‚Äãhukkin in #217
  • Fix typo by @‚Äãjwilk in #230
  • üîß Bump GH actions by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in #244
  • üîß Update benchmark pkg versions by @‚Äãchrisjsewell in #245

New Contributors

Thanks to üéâ

  • @‚Äãjwilk made their first contribution in #230
  • @‚Äãholamgadol made their first contribution in #227
  • @‚Äãredstoneleo made their first contribution in #229

Full Changelog: https://github.com/executablebooks/markdown-it-py/compare/v2.1.0...v2.2.0

2.1.0 - 2022-04-15

This release is primarily to replace the attrs package dependency, with the built-in Python dataclasses package.

This should not be a breaking change, for most use cases.

  • ‚¨ÜÔ∏è UPGRADE: Drop support for EOL Python 3.6 (#194)
  • ‚ôªÔ∏è REFACTOR: Move Rule/Delimiter classes from attrs to dataclass (#211)
  • ‚ôªÔ∏è REFACTOR: Move Token class from attrs to dataclass (#211)
  • ‚ÄºÔ∏è Remove deprecated NestedTokens and nest_tokens
  • ‚ú® NEW: Save ordered list numbering (#192)
  • üêõ FIX: Combination of blockquotes, list and newlines causes IndexError (#207)

2.0.1 - 2022-24-01

  • üêõ FIX: Crash when file ends with empty blockquote line.
  • ‚ú® NEW: Add inline_definitions option. This option allows for definition token to be inserted into the token stream, at the point where the definition is located in the source text. It is useful for cases where one wishes to capture a "loseless" syntax tree of the parsed Markdown (in conjunction with the store_labels option).

2.0.0 - 2021-12-03

  • ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Update: Sync with markdown-it v12.1.0 and CommonMark v0.30
  • ‚ôªÔ∏è REFACTOR: Port mdurl and punycode for URL normalisation (thanks to @‚Äãhukkin!).

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 73a0147 üöÄ RELEASE: v2.2.0 (#250)
  • 53ca3e9 üêõ FIX: CLI crash on non-utf8 character (#247)
  • 6491bc2 üìö Add email to security section (#249)
  • cf8b2d8 üîß Create SECURITY.md (#248)
  • ae03c61 üêõ FIX: CVE-2023-26303 (#246)
  • 2c93e0b üìö DOCS: Update the example (#229)
  • 4670f0c ‚¨ÜÔ∏è UPGRADE: Allow linkify-it-py v2 (#218)
  • 032c742 üìö DOCS: Add section about markdown renderer (#227)
  • c9f6856 üîß Update benchmark pkg versions (#245)
  • 2160a3d üîß Bump GH actions (#244)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=markdown-it-py&package-manager=pip&previous-version=0.6.2&new-version=2.2.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/network/alerts).
